findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: IAC - Insecure Access Control
findings.description: The contract includes certain functions that lack an access control mechanism, allowing unauthorized users to call critical functions and mutate state variables.

findings.title: ZD - Zero Division
findings.description: The contract is using variables that may be set to zero as denominators, leading to unpredictable and potentially harmful results.

findings.title: STVI - Swap Token Variable Inconsistency
findings.description: The `manualSwap` function allows users to trigger a manual swap of tokens for ETH. However, the contract does not reset or decrease the `tokensForDev` and `tokensForMarketing` variables after the manual swap.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration can save gas when it is defined.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages. These error messages do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain events in its code. However, these events are not emitted within the contract's functions. As a result, these declared events are redundant and serve no purpose within the contract's current implementation.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain variables that are not used in a meaningful way by the contract. As a result, these variables are redundant.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.
